User_Review: A freesync Xbox monitor that uses the same Samsung 75hz va panel found in basically every 75hz curved monitor on the market but at 50-70 less then those options.

They look amazing. I mounted them as you can see in the photo but it worked great. Looks a little odd in the back as the piece that hooks into the stand isn't something you can remove, but I'm not worried about that at all
They look amazing. Video quality is 'alright' at best.
I love this monitor overall. The picture is great and everything on it looks so much better.
These are not high end gaming monitors, but they work well in the office environment and the occasional steam side game
It’s a simple monitor with a HDMI connection and a headphone port, not even a usb port.
I loved this monitor for 4 months and then it got a line all across the screen. I contacted Samsung and it was still under warranty so I shipped it back only to have it returned not repaired.
The LED light is sorta bright, so I end up putting some tape over it so I can sleep at night, but its no big deal. The picture quality is so much nicer than my old TV, and it was a 1080p as well.

These are great value, decent curved monitors. We have them mounted in pairs and love the look. When seated in front of them the curve seems to disappear and it's a great surface to work from multiple windows from.

The picture quality is ok. I thought it should be sharper. I bought it for streaming devices like amazon fair stick only realized that it didn’t have a built-in speaker after talking to the tech support.
I contacted Samsung and it was still under warranty so I shipped it back only to have it returned not repaired. They said the monitor panel was damaged and it wasn't covered to be repaired.
I bought i new and it sat on my desk without any damage. I read that this is a thing Samsung pulls with warranty service.
